dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, B, I was reading this article, right? From, uh, Project Syndicate, and it's... it's a bit wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, B, I was reading this article, right? From, uh, Project Syndicate, and it's... it's a bit wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah? What's got your attention, A?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah? What's got your attention, A?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's about mental health at Davos. And the author, Bernard J. Tyson, he's saying, like, Davos is totally the wrong place to even talk about it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's about mental health at Davos. And the author, Bernard J. Tyson, he's saying, like, Davos is totally the wrong place to even talk about it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Davos is clearly an appropriate forum in which to raise the issue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? Really? But isn't that, um, isn't that exactly where global leaders *should* be talking about it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? Really? But isn't that, um, isn't that exactly where global leaders should be talking about it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's what I thought! But then he goes on to say, uh, the WHO study, which found depression and anxiety cost the global economy a *trillion* dollars, and every dollar invested gets you four back... he calls that a 'welcome distraction'.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's what I thought! But then he goes on to say, uh, the W H O study, which found depression and anxiety cost the global economy a trillion dollars, and every dollar invested gets you four back... he calls that a welcome distraction.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The WHO study is a welcome intervention.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A *distraction*? [overlaps] A trillion dollars lost! That's not a distraction, that's, like, a huge problem!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A distraction? A trillion dollars lost! That's not a distraction, that's, like, a huge problem!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And then he implies the WHO is, quote, 'clandestinely trying to suppress mental health awareness'.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And then he implies the W H O is, quote, clandestinely trying to suppress mental health awareness.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The WHO study is a welcome intervention. For too long, we have detached the mind from the body and regarded mental conditions as something separate from our overall health. As a result, millions of people needing mental health support have been ignored...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, hold on. This has to be sarcasm. No one seriously thinks the WHO is trying to *suppress* mental health awareness, especially with those numbers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, hold on. This has to be sarcasm. No one seriously thinks the W H O is trying to suppress mental health awareness, especially with those numbers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? But the way he's writing it, it's so straight-faced. He's got these four 'critical priorities' to 'undermine mental health'.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? But the way he's writing it, it's so straight-faced. He's got these four critical priorities to undermine mental health.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In this spirit, I urge leaders joining me in Davos to consider adopting four critical priorities to support mental health and wellness.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, this is going to be good. What's, uh, what's his first priority for undermining?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, this is going to be good. What's, uh, what's his first priority for undermining?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, first, he says we need to publicize the stigma around mental health in the workplace. And, like, everyone should suffer out loud.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, first, he says we need to publicize the stigma around mental health in the workplace. And, like, everyone should suffer out loud.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: First, we need to reduce the stigma surrounding mental health in the workplace. No one should suffer in silence with a condition that can be treated and even prevented in some cases.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Suffer out loud? [overlaps] So the opposite of creating a supportive environment? Uh, yeah, that's definitely not what we want.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Suffer out loud? So the opposite of creating a supportive environment? Uh, yeah, that's definitely not what we want.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And then he says we should 'exacerbate mental health inequity' and actually, um, boycott things like Zimbabwe's Friendship Bench.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And then he says we should exacerbate mental health inequity and actually, um, boycott things like Zimbabwe's Friendship Bench.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Furthermore, we must reduce mental health inequity, a frequently ignored issue. ... There are some innovative approaches to addressing this problem, such as Zimbabwes Friendship Bench, and I look forward to learning more about this project from one of its representatives in Davos.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The Friendship Bench is, like, a fantastic, low-cost, community-based solution! Why would anyone want to boycott that? This is pure, unadulterated irony.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Friendship Bench is, like, a fantastic, low-cost, community-based solution! Why would anyone want to boycott that? This is pure, unadulterated irony.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. He's basically saying, 'Let's do everything wrong.' Like, shift from well-care to sick-care, and, um, traumatize communities instead of nurturing them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. He's basically saying, Let's do everything wrong. Like, shift from well-care to sick-care, and, um, traumatize communities instead of nurturing them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Third, our health systems must shift from sick-care to well-care. ... The game-changer will be found not in hospitals or clinics, but in communities that nurture rather than traumatize the next generations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. And the last one, I bet it's about, uh, separating mind and body, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. And the last one, I bet it's about, uh, separating mind and body, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: You got it. Remove mental health services from primary care, act like it's irrelevant. And he's saying this like he's *discouraged* mental health will be a *smaller* part of Davos discussions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You got it. Remove mental health services from primary care, act like it's irrelevant. And he's saying this like he's discouraged mental health will be a smaller part of Davos discussions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last, and most relevant for health-care leaders, we must redouble our efforts to connect mind and body. By better integrating mental health services into primary care systems... This year, I am encouraged and gratified to see that mental health will be a larger part of the discussions in Davos.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, the author, uh, Bernard J. Tyson, he's actually a CEO of Kaiser Permanente. So he's clearly trying to shock people into seeing the *real* importance of these issues.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the author, uh, Bernard J. Tyson, he's actually a C E O of Kaiser Permanente. So he's clearly trying to shock people into seeing the real importance of these issues.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bernard J. Tyson is CEO of Kaiser Permanente.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, by presenting the worst possible solutions, he's highlighting what *should* be done. It's a really clever, if somewhat unsettling, way to make a point.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, by presenting the worst possible solutions, he's highlighting what should be done. It's a really clever, if somewhat unsettling, way to make a point.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely unsettling. But you can't ignore the message underneath all that sarcasm: we *need* to prioritize mental health, integrate it, reduce stigma, and invest in it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely unsettling. But you can't ignore the message underneath all that sarcasm: we need to prioritize mental health, integrate it, reduce stigma, and invest in it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It's a call to action, disguised as a call to, uh, regression.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It's a call to action, disguised as a call to, uh, regression.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well put. A, uh, powerful way to shake things up, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well put. A, uh, powerful way to shake things up, I guess.
